body_text:
URL names are global across the whole site. Typically we prefix them with something like normandy.control.index. Looking at what we've got thusfar in the project, we haven't really been consistent.
@mythmon Which do you like better as URL names: normandy.control.index or just control.index? Should we also use URL namespaces?
body:
URL names are global across the whole site. Typically we prefix them with something like `normandy.control.index`. Looking at what we've got thusfar in the project, we haven't really been consistent.

@mythmon Which do you like better as URL names: `normandy.control.index` or just `control.index`? Should we also use [URL namespaces](https://docs.djangoproject.com/es/1.9/topics/http/urls/#url-namespaces-and-included-urlconfs)?
body_html:
URL names are global across the whole site. Typically we prefix them with something like normandy.control.index. Looking at what we've got thusfar in the project, we haven't really been consistent.

@mythmon Which do you like better as URL names: normandy.control.index or just control.index? Should we also use URL namespaces?
